member.name: T:AGS.Types.FolderListHybrid`2
member.summary: This is a class that can be viewed both as a list, and as a folder collection.

member.name: T:AGS.Types.BaseFolderCollection`2
member.summary: Base class for items which are maintained in a folder structure, like Views and AudioClips.
member.typeparam: type of the item, eg. View
type of the folder, eg. ViewFolder

member.name: M:AGS.Types.GUIControl.GetSpritesUsed
member.summary: Gets a list of all sprites used by this control. Useful for exporting the control.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.GUIControl.UpdateSpritesWithMapping(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,System.Int32})
member.summary: Updates sprite numbers on the control using the supplied mapping. Usually used after this control has just been imported from an external source, to link up its imported sprites.

member.name: T:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration
member.summary: Operations to handle files under Source Control. If the current game is not under Source Control, these operations will all work on the local file system only.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.AttemptToGetWriteAccess(System.String)
member.summary: Attempt to get write access to the specified file, checking out the file if necessary. If this fails, a dialog will be displayed to the user and false will be returned.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.AttemptToGetWriteAccess(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Attempt to get write access to all of the specified files, checking them out if necessary. If one of them fails, a dialog will be displayed to the user and false will be returned.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.DeleteFileOnDiskAndSourceControl(System.String[])
member.summary: Deletes the specified files from the disk. If they are under source control, prompts the user and asks them whether they also want to delete the files from source control.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.RenameFileOnDiskAndSourceControl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames the specified file on the disk and in the source control repository, if applicable.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.RegisterFileIconAssociation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Links the specified file extension with the specified icon key. The Pending Checkins window will use this to determine what icon to display for the files.
member.param: The file extension to register. Should start with a period.
The icon key, previously registered with the GUIController's RegisterIcon method.

member.name: E:AGS.Types.ISourceControlIntegration.GetSourceControlFileList
member.summary: Fired by the Pending Checkins window to get a list of files that comprise the game source code. All source-controllable files should be returned, and the Pending Checkins window will then display any that are not currently checked in.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.IGame.CreateNewView(AGS.Types.IViewFolder)
member.summary: Creates a new view in the specified folder, refreshes the project tree and returns the new view.

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IGame.Views
member.summary: Accesses the root view folder, which contains all views at the top level as well as sub folders. RequiredAGSVersion: 3.0.1.33

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IGame.Sprites
member.summary: Accesses the root sprite folder, which contains all sprites at the top level, and subfolders. RequiredAGSVersion: 3.0.2.38

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IGame.ScriptsAndHeaders
member.summary: Gets the list of ScriptandHeader RequiredAGSVersion: 3.3.0.1145

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IGame.PlayerCharacter
member.summary: Gets the player character RequiredAGSVersion: 3.3.0.1147

member.summary: Marks the view as deleted and available for re-creation

member.summary: Returns an unused View ID and allocates it as in use

member.summary: Returns the View object associated with the supplied ID

member.name: M:AGS.Types.Game.ConvertCoordinatesToNativeResolution
member.summary: WARNING: Only call this if an old game has just been loaded in, otherwise all sizes will get doubled!!!

member.name: E:AGS.Types.Game.ViewListUpdated
member.summary: Fired when an external client adds/removes views

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Game.SavedXmlVersion
member.summary: The version of the Game.agf file that was loaded from disk. This is null if the game has not yet been saved.

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Game.SavedXmlEditorVersion
member.summary: The editor version read from the Game.agf file that was loaded from disk. This is null if the game has not yet been saved or is an older version.

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Game.SavedXmlVersionIndex
member.summary: The version-index of the Game.agf file that was loaded from disk. This is null if the game has not yet been saved.

member.summary: Full path to the directory where the game is located

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Game.FilesAddedOrRemoved
member.summary: If this is set, then the editor is more forceful about making the user save the game on exit.

member.summary: Returns the minimum width of the room background for the current game resolution.

member.summary: Returns the highest numbered View in the game

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Game.IsHighResolution

member.name: M:AGS.Types.Scripts.AddAt(AGS.Types.Script,System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper private function to add a script. The index is the internal data structure index to which we would like to add the script. The function automatically finds the ScriptAndHeader that matches the current script file name and adds the script to the pair, if it doesn't exist. If the pair is not found, a new item is added
member.param: The script to add
The desired index where -1 indicates no specific location.

member.name: M:AGS.Types.Scripts.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator to traverse the scripts
member.remarks: The class must use this version of GetEnumerator and not of . Otherwise existing plugins will break.

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Scripts.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of script items in the list.
member.remarks: This property scans the entire list (O(N) complexity)

member.name: P:AGS.Types.Scripts.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a script based on its index number.
member.remarks: This method scans the entire list (O(N) complexity) and thus it is not recommended to be used when traversing the list. Use the enumerator instead to perform for loops.

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IScriptEditorControl.SelectionEnd
member.summary: The end offset of the current selection. RequiredAGSVersion: 3.1.0.48

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IScriptEditorControl.SelectedText
member.summary: The currently selected text. RequiredAGSVersion: 3.1.0.48

member.name: P:AGS.Types.IScriptEditorControl.CursorPosition
member.summary: The current offset of the cursor. RequiredAGSVersion: 3.1.0.48

member.name: T:AGS.Types.AudioClipFileType
member.summary: This needs to match the enum definition in agsdefns.sh

member.name: M:AGS.Types.ViewFolder.FindViewByID(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds the View object for the specified view number. Returns null if the view is not found.
member.param: View number to look for
Whether to also search sub-folders

member.name: M:AGS.Types.EnumTypeConverter.GetEnumDescription(System.Enum)
member.summary: Gets Enum Value's Description Attribute
member.param: The value you want the description attribute for
member.returns: The description, if any, else it's .ToString()

member.name: M:AGS.Types.EnumTypeConverter.GetEnumDescription(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the description for certaing named value in an Enumeration
member.param: The type of the Enumeration
The name of the Enumeration value
member.returns: The description, if any, else the passed name

member.name: M:AGS.Types.EnumTypeConverter.GetEnumValue(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of an Enum, based on it's Description Attribute or named value
member.param: The Enum type
The description or name of the element
member.returns: The value, or the passed in description, if it was not found

member.name: P:AGS.Types.AutoComplete.ScriptFunction.HideOnMainFunctionList
member.summary: If this function should be hidden from the main autocomplete list. This applies to member function definitions, since the import statement will be used instead.
